text: Chemokines are small soluble molecules that are best known for their potent ability to induce cancer cell growth by inflammation .
Many types of cancer cells express chemokines and chemokine receptors [ 1 ] .

The accumulated evidence indicates that the <extra_id_0> chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CCL5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> C-C chemokine receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , which are potent chemotactic factors for inflammatory cells , may be significantly involved in the proliferation and metastasis of several cancers .

Intermediate and strong <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is significantly associated with nonmetastatic development of colorectal cancer [ 2 ] , melanoma [ 3 ] , hepatoma [ 4 ] , glioblastoma , Hodgkin lymphoma [ 5 ] , as well as oral and prostate cancer cells [ 6 ] .
Local production of the <extra_id_0> CCL5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is also important in the progression of breast cancer [ 7 ] , and also correlates with poor prognosis [ 8 ] .
Meanwhile , <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> disruption has been demonstrated to inhibit experimental tumor growth and metastasis of pancreatic cancer [ 9 ] .

In addition , host absence of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> potentiates the delay of tumor growth [ 10 ] , and <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitors prevented cancer cell growth , such as prostate cancer [ 11 ] , breast cancer , hepatoma cells [ 4 ] , and lung cancer [ 12 ] .
These data suggest that the deficiency of inflammatory chemokine receptor <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may function as a suppressive receptor in cancer progression .
However , more studies are required to describe how <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deficiency acts in the inhibition of tumor development .

<extra_id_0> Interleukin-1 receptor antagonist <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a member of the IL-1 family , is a naturally occurring <extra_id_0> cytokine <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that competitively blocks the IL-1 receptor [ 13 ] .

Because <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to inhibit tumor progression by promoting antitumor immune responses and by enhancing the activity of chemotherapy , numerous studies have examined the ability of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to block tumor progression .
<extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was reduced in prostate [ 14 ] , breast [ 15 ] , and skin cancer [ 16 ] .
It was also reported that endogenous <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> deficient mice developed aggressive tumors following exposure to carcinogens [ 17 ] .
Meanwhile , proliferation of the melanoma cells that were transduced with <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was reduced and inhibited melanoma development [ 18 ] .
IL-1R blockade also reduced hepatic tumor growth [ 19 ] .

Moreover , it has also been reported that <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reduces fibrosarcoma development [ 20 ] , B16 melanoma growth and metastasis [ 21 ] , colon adenocarcinoma growth [ 22 ] , and skin cancer development [ 23 ] .
IL-1 knockout mice injected with melanoma failed to develop solid tumors [ 24 ] .

It was also found that <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , combined with temozolomide and docetaxel chemotherapy , demonstrated more significant antitumor activity against B16 melanoma cells in vivo [ 25 ] .
These data indicate that <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is important as a tumor growth suppressing <extra_id_0> cytokine <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
NF-kappaB plays a crucial role in the suppression of apoptosis , as well as the induction of cell proliferation and inflammation , and is closely associated with cancer development [ 26 ] .

Constitutive activation of NF-kappaB has been described in a great number of cancers including colon cancers , prostate cancers and melanoma [ 27 ] , and was found to up-regulate anti-apoptotic genes and / or down regulate apoptotic gene expression [ 28 ] .
Although NF-kappaB promotes tumor growth , it is required for the immune system to function normally [ 29 ] .

Studies on <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice demonstrated that <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is essential for <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and IFNgamma expression in T lymphocytes [ 30 ] .

C-Rel - deficient mice also have a tissue - specific deficiency of various cytokines and growth factors in T cells and macrophages affecting both innate and humoral immune responses in the host [ 31 ] .

Therefore , NF-kappaB can be specially targeted to prevent cancer cell growth by ( 1 ) directly affecting apoptotic cancer cell death , ( 2 ) stimulating tumor killing lymphocytes infiltration or ( 3 ) increasing the production of tumor killing lymphokines .
Activation of NF-kappaB is important in the regulation of CCR - mediated tumor growth and metastasis .

It was reported that inhibition of NF-kappaB by dehydroxymethyl-epoxyquinomicin ( DHMEQ ) induces cell death of primary effusion lymphoma by inhibition of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression [ 32 ] .
Activation of NF-kappaB also increases <extra_id_0> CCL5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated oral cancer motility ( 5 ) and lung metastasis [ 33 ] .
Thus , it is possible that inhibition of NF-kappaB could be involved in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediated tumor development .

NF-kappaB transcription factor binding sites are present in the promoter region of proinflammatory cytokine genes , such as <extra_id_0> IL-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> GM-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> KC <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 34 ] .
On the other hand , the <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a negative regulator of the inflammatory response .
Several studies have demonstrated the ability of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to abrogate the proinflammatory effects of IL-1 .

Smith et al . suggested that the regulation of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression is a complex event involving the interactions of three different transcription factors ; NF-kappaB / <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / GA - binding protein binding site [ 35 ] .

Nuclear translocation of NF-kappaB ( <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) was significantly enhanced and prolonged in <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient mice , compared to that in wild type mice [ 36 ] .

<extra_id_0> Intracellular IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> icIL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) was found to inhibit IL-1 by blocking NF-kappaB signal transduction pathways in inflammatory responses [ 37 ] .

Because IL-1 has been shown to be an inducer of NF-kappaB activation [ 38 ] , we hypothesized that the expression of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could play an important role in the autocrine activation of transcription factors NF-kappaB or vice versa .

Thus , the aim of this study was to evaluate the roles of NF-kappaB and <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the <extra_id_0> chemokine receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated suppression of tumor development .
